Description: This is a simple, smoky wine, earthy and brimming in a mix of compost and mint. Medium bodied and moderate in acidity, it's ripe and round.
Title: Charles Krug 2014 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Description: This lacks Pinot's velvety richness, substituting instead an irregular mouthfeel due in part to unripe, green tannins. Makes up for it with a wealth of raspberry and cherry jam flavors and a sweet oak note. Drink now.
Title: Sebastiani 2010 Robert's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Description: This looks, smells and tastes so young that it might have come right out of the fermenting tank. It is tight to the point of reductive, with tart fruit flavors of cranberry and rhubarb, and stiff, chalky tannins.
Title: Youngberg Hill Vineyards 2013 Jordan Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

Description: This Pinot is ripe in jammy cherry fruit, and it has a smoky, buttery richness from oak. But it's a little soft and heavy for the variety, which is perhaps to be expected given its Alexander Valley origin.
Title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2010 Wetzel Family Estate Pinot Noir (Alexander Valley)

Description: Very Beaujolais-like, and still showing a bit of spritz in the mouthfeel, this offers pretty cherry fruit in a fun, forward, clean and simple style. Note the low alcohol.
Title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2010 Whole Cluster Fermented Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Description: Very ripe, sweet and oaky, tasting almost like a dessert wine, or at least a melted cherry and plum pastry. Delicious in an obvious way, but lacks complexity, and doesn't seem like an ager. Drink up.
Title: Gary Farrell 2008 Starr Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Description: Warm red-cherry aromas meet with light hints of sage and leather on the very shy nose of this bottling from one of the region's larger growers. The flavors are also light and rustic, with tart cranberry and hints of leather and game.
Title: Scheid Vineyards 2015 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

Description: With scents and flavors of chocolate-covered cherries, this pretty and accessible Pinot Noir promises a bit more than it delivers. The light cherry fruit turns a bit earthy and tannic as it winds into a quick finish.
Title: Silvan Ridge 2010 Freedom Hill Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Description: A light entry holds flavors of strawberry and tomato leaf, then turns tannic. Chewy and earthy, with more than a hint of seed and stem, this wine comes from biodynamically farmed grapes that add some earthy nuances, but put too much emphasis on green tea, stemmy flavors.
Title: Archery Summit 2004 Renegade Ridge Estate Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Description: A sound, everyday Pinot Noir, with cherry, currant, cola, tobacco and pepper flavors wrapped into rather jagged tannins. Drink now.
Title: Vision Cellars 2007 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

Description: Decent, everyday Pinot, with good varietal character, if not especially complex. The wine is dry, silky and crisp, with modest cherry and cola flavors.
Title: Mountain View 2007 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

Description: Dry and thin, with diluted cherry flavors. Oak fortunately adds needed vanilla and smoky char richness. The lack of fruity concentration accentuates the alcohol and acidity. Drink now.
Title: Dutch Henry Winery 2009 Pinot Noir (Mount Veeder)

Description: Easy and uncomplicated, this is dry, light-bodied and fine in acidity, with flavors of sour cherry candy, cola and smoky oak.
Title: Sebastiani 2010 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Description: Enormously rich, this Pinot Noir has gigantic fruit flavors of blackberries, cherries, raspberries, cola, mocha, anise and pepper. Some will call it a fruit bomb because it doesn't have much structure to balance all that extravagance.
Title: Loring Wine Company 2007 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Description: Falls somewhere between everyday and fancy, with an unripe, green edge and sharp acidity marring the silky texture and raspberry and cherry fruit.
Title: Sebastiani 2011 Robert's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Description: Far and away the freshest and most interesting of the three vintages submitted for review. The fruit retains more of its youthful gloss; it's riper and shows more cherry character, along with bright, spicy highlights. The tannins are proportionate and less earthy and herbal. This is no barn-burner, but it's a good quaffer.
Title: Honeywood Winery 2006 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Description: Fruity and simple, a mélange of thorn bush berry and tree fruit flavors encased in silky tannins and adequate acids. A good candidate for a tutorial on Pinot Noir.
Title: Saintsbury 2001 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Description: Full-bodied and heavy in the Loring style, an extracted wine filled with exciting fruit and berry flavors, but lacking the delicacy and finesse you expect from Pinot Noir.
Title: Loring Wine Company 2007 Keefer Ranch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

Description: Keefer has not been Loring's most successful bottling. The '06 is pleasant, and in its own way delicious, with upfront raspberry, cherry, cola and smoky vanilla flavors balanced with crisp acidity. But it has a candied one-dimensionality, and doesn't seem likely to age.
Title: Loring Wine Company 2006 Keefer Ranch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

Description: Lake Chelan is one of the few regions in Washington State that can take a whack at growing Pinot Noir. For this bottling, the winemakers elected to blend in 5% Malbec—a small percentage, but one that seems to have taken over the flavor. Not a trace of Pinot Noir character remains, just a strong Bourbon-barrel flavor and a bit of alcoholic heat.
Title: Wapato Point Cellars 2009 Clos CheValle Reserve Pinot Noir (Lake Chelan)

Description: Lean and earthy, marked by tobacco and white pepper, tomato and dill aromas and flavors. In the mouth, it's very dry, with easy tannins. There's some tart cherry fruit that shows up in the mid-palate, and the finish turns slightly bitter.
Title: Charles Krug 2000 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Description: Light in the glass with shy aromas of red berries and a touch of anise, this wine is soft and earthy on the palate. An energy emerges around mid-sip, with sour cherries and juniper elements beginning to show by the finish.
Title: Rancho Sisquoc 2013 Flood Family Vineyards Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Of Loring's dozen single-vineyard Pinots released this season, this is one of the softest, sweetest and simplest. It's pretty good, with polished cherry pie filling, cola, carob, licorice and spice flavors. But it could have a firmer structure.
Title: Loring Wine Company 2006 Durell Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Pretty fierce in acidity, but flavorful enough, with plenty of raspberry and cherry jam, accented with cola and spices. Drink now, after decanting.
Title: Perbacco Cellars 2007 Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)

Description: Rich flavors of cherries, cola, black raspberries, oranges and pomegranates are wrapped into a silky texture in this Pinot Noir. It's a little deficient in acidity, which makes it taste simple and one-dimensional.
Title: Adler Fels 2007 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Description: Ripe enough in raspberry, cherry and mulberry fruit, with some flashy notes, but it's all sweet, upfront flavor, with not much else going on. The acidity is fine and the tannins are pretty, but this ultimately is a fairly simple, jammy wine.
Title: Gary Farrell 2008 Hallberg Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Description: Shows ripe, grapey raspberry and cherry jam flavors, with a bite of citrusy acidity. A good Pinot Noir for drinking with roast salmon or a juicy hamburger.
Title: Carmel Road 2010 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

Description: Some light Graham cracker aromas come up quickly, but in the mouth the wine all but disappears. Watery and thin, it shows little promise of further improvement.
Title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2010 Signature Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Description: Tastes strong and distinctive, with well-etched white pepper, black raspberry, tobacco and herb flavors. This earthy wine feels silky smooth on the palate, with crisp acids, but is a little one-dimensional for the price.
Title: Wedell Cellars 2000 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

Description: The richness of this bottling seems to have been falling over the last few vintages. The '06 is very dry and tart, with modest cherry, rhubarb, cola and spice flavors that are unlikely to evolve.
Title: Dutton-Goldfield 2006 Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Description: The tart hard fruit is well hidden behind chalky tongue-scraping acids. The wine quickly hits a finish with tough tannins and a residual note of wet paper.
Title: Chehalem 2014 Ridgecrest Vineyards Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Description: The winery's single-vineyard 2011 Pinots varied widely in this erratic vintage. Dry and tart, the wine is marked by a vegetal streak that cuts through the raspberries and cherries.
Title: Gary Farrell 2011 Bacigalupi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Description: There is an odd, piercing edge to the aromas, a mix of acetic acid and pungent herb, with a hint of diesel. Somehow it's not off-putting, just atypical. The light, tart fruit is a mix of rhubarb and cranberry, very earthy and tasting of dirt and bark in the finish. This could be quite pleasant with a hearty, rustic dish such as beef Bourgogne.
Title: Silvan Ridge 2006 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Description: There's a peppy ease to the aromas of this bottling, with light raspberry and rhubarb lifted by cola and sarsaparilla notes. The palate is a tad fruit-punchy, with red cherry and some thyme to give depth.
Title: Carmel Road 2014 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

Description: This is an everyday Pinot, with some classy features. It's silky and elegant in the mouth, with good acidity. The raspberry and cherry flavors are one-dimensional and sweet.
Title: Carmel Road 2009 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

Description: This is the first wine made from Oregon grapes by this southern California winery. But one can't help but wonder if shipping fruit all the way down the coast might bang it up a bit. For whatever reason, this wine tastes fractured, metallic and chalky. There is a core of black cherry, but it seems surrounded by gun-metal flavors, which stick to the palate and abruptly shut down the finish.
Title: Loring Wine Company 2006 Shea Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Description: This modest Pinot offers light strawberry fruit, a dash of cola, and a component of earth and stem that overtakes the finish. It hints at green tannins, with a bit of brown sugar sweetness, perhaps from aging in 30% new oak.
Title: Silvan Ridge 2009 Lazy River Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Description: This opens with a strong scent of herb and bud; it's sharp and aggressively leafy. The wine follows with similar flavors. The light fruit flavors of plum and berry are quickly suffocated with leaf, herb, earth, spice and tannin. Time may be the answer.
Title: Domaine Meriwether 2004 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Description: This tasty but ultimately simple Pinot is soft and sweetly forward in raspberry jam, cola, brown sugar and oak flavors. Drink up.
Title: Santa Barbara Winery 2012 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Description: This wine's pink color edges ever so slightly toward brown, and offers aromas of orange juice and pink rose petals. It's a tad flat on the palate, suggesting sour orange and lemon rinds, a touch of maraschino cherry and a slight baking-soda minerality.
Title: La Crema 2016 Rose of Pinot Noir (Monterey)

Description: Too dark and heavy for a Pinot Noir, with extracted, jammy flavors of grilled blackberries and cherries, as well as an herbal note of jasmine tea. Almost more like a Rhône wine, although on its own, it's a nice, dry sipper. Ready now.
Title: Taz 2007 Fiddlestix Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Description: Very extracted and ripe, this wine's voluptuous cherry, currant, licorice and spice flavors are compromised by excessive softness. Doesn't show much complexity beyond the fruit, so drink now.
Title: Loring Wine Company 2007 Garys' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Description: Very light and shy on the nose, this wine with patience shows pomegranate punch and rain-slicked slate. The palate offers tart cranberry, a touch of Earl Grey tea and pencil-lead flavors.
Title: Consilience 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Vinegary overtones suggest a volatile wine from the first sniff. Flavors are high-toned as well, with plum and cherry. Some sort of barrel treatment brings in dark chocolate and espresso, with slightly burnt, bitter tannins.
Title: Silvan Ridge 2011 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Description: With a soft, simple mouthfeel, this lightly-colored Pinot Noir isn't an ager. But it does provide pleasant drinking now, with raspberry and cherry pie, cola, cinnamon and brown- sugar flavors.
Title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2012 Wetzel Family Estate Pinot Noir (Alexander Valley)

Description: A generic expression of the variety with some notions of ripe plum, dark cherry and black pepper, this straightforward wine is ready to drink now. It takes on full tannic strength on the finish.
Title: Napa Cellars 2013 Classic Collection Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)

Description: A green, vegetal note marks the berry and cola flavors. It's a big, sturdy wine that's high in alcohol and slightly warm, with considerable tannins. It doesn't seem likely to improve with age.
Title: Terra Valentine 2010 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Description: A villages-style Pinot, this has a mouthfeel that scours, with flavors of sour cherry candy, cola and sandalwood flavors.
Title: La Crema 2010 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Drinks rather earthy and simple, and also short on fruit. There's some cherry and raspberry flavor but it's thin. Instead, oaky flavors are meant to substitute.
Title: Saintsbury 2001 Garnet Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Description: For some tasters, this will seem a bit earthy; for others there is a note of animal. The fruit is thin, the finish chalky and astringent.
Title: Tyee Wine Cellars 2007 Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Description: Heavy, soft and a little sweet, this lacks the vibrant dryness and zest a good Pinot should have. The blackberry and cherry flavors have a slightly burnt, pie-filling flavor. Domaine Chandon has done better with Pinot Noir in the past, and it can do better than this.
Title: Domaine Chandon 2005 Reserve L'Argile Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Description: It show the vintage's weakness, with a vegetal edge to the cherries and oak.
Title: Gary Farrell 2011 Russian River Selection Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Description: It's soft and simple, with earthy flavors of mushrooms, cola and raspberries that lead to a dry, fairly tannic finish.
Title: Soquel Vineyards 2012 Partners' Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Description: Light and delicate, it attracts more for its stylish finesse than for any power or ageability. Berry and earth flavors are framed in modest tannins and soft acids, and there's some bitterness from the middle palate through the finish.
Title: Barefoot Cellars 1999 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

Description: Marked by fresh fruity acids and primary tastes of raspberries, cherries and cola, this is a pleasantly dry Pinot Noir. It's an everyday type that shows the silkiness of the variety.
Title: La Crema 2008 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

Description: On the thin side of light-bodied, this has an abundance of oak that overpowers the subtle fruit in this wine from an estate property in a relatively warm appellation. Ripe dark cherry takes on a baked quality here.
Title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2012 Estate Grown and Bottled Pinot Noir (Alexander Valley)

Description: Other than a sugary sweetness, this wine shows all the hallmarks of a very nice Pinot Noir from this famed vineyard. The raspberry, cherry and vanilla flavors are accented by dusty spices, and the texture is silky. But the wine just doesn't taste dry.
Title: Villa Mt. Eden 2005 Bien Nacido Vineyard Grand Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

Description: Rather spare despite the cherry-berry, cola and spice flavors. The tannins are ultralight, and the acidity you'd expect from this cool coastal appellation isn't there. That leaves alcohol and fruit and a certain flabbiness.
Title: La Crema 2001 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Shows good, rich flavors of currants, cherry and blackberry pie filling, cola, mocha and spices. But the mouthfeel is heavy, and the wine is a touch overripe. Now through 2010.
Title: Loring Wine Company 2007 Russell Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Paso Robles)

Description: Silky, light-bodied and dry, with flavors of cherries, cola and herbs. It's a simple wine that gets the Pinot concept across in a direct way.
Title: Cartlidge & Browne 2008 Pinot Noir (California)

Description: Simple, dry and direct. The silky texture houses slightly green flavors of tea, cherries and cola. Ready now.
Title: Taz 2007 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Too big by far for a Pinot Noir, this single-vineyard bottling is heavy-handed. It has caramelized cherry and blackberry fruit flavors and a soft, candied quality. Ultimately, it lacks the elegance and delicacy of a fine wine.
Title: Vision Cellars 2006 Las Alturas Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Description: A pleasant enough wine with moderate body and soft tannins. Flavors range from herbal to cherry and plum. An earthy note pervades, however, with a bright finish.
Title: Martin Family Vineyards 2001 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Description: From a little-used San Luis Obispo County appellation, a simple wine with little to recommend it beyond cleanliness and some berry flavors. Fully dry, it has silky tannins and some firm acids.
Title: York Mountain Winery 2000 Stephen's Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

Description: Heavy and dull, like cherry pie filling, dusted with cinnamon and cocoa, without the pie shell. That baked crust provides the crunchy structure, which this fruit bomb lacks.
Title: Loring Wine Company 2007 Aubaine Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

Description: It's too hot for Pinot Noir in Paso Robles, right? This wine shows why. It's not bad, but clumsy, with heavy, earthy flavors. It lacks delicacy and subtlety, which is what Pinot Noir is all about.
Title: Zenaida Cellars 2000 Pinot Noir (Paso Robles)

Description: Raspberry jam, red currant and liqueur flavors mark this strong Pinot Noir. It's all about fruit and oak, with little subtlety, and the hard tannins will never go away.
Title: Burrell School Vineyards 2009 Estate Reserve Principal's Choice Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Description: Springhill Cellars has been around for two decades, but this new release of the estate Pinot Noir is a bit of a disappointment. Light, sweet and simple, it turns a bit medicinal on the finish.
Title: Springhill Cellars 2006 Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Description: The 2005 Pinot Noir from Honeywood is a dead ringer for—guess what!—the 2004 Pinot Noir from the same winery. Soft entry, herbal and somewhat stemmy mid-palate, tannic, slightly hot finish.
Title: Honeywood Winery 2005 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Description: This sustainably grown Arroyo Seco wine has a very reluctant nose that eventually gives off some red-purple fruits. The palate offers a bit more, with cranberry and some slate.
Title: Carmel Road 2013 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

Description: A surprising  Pinot Noir from the Puget Sound AVA. Tart, tannic and lightly spicy, it presents itself as a rustic café red.
Title: Mount Baker Vineyards 2005 Pinot Noir (Puget Sound)

Description: An acceptable effort, with sour acidity, this Pinot has raspberry and cherry flavors that are marked with a hit of mint.
Title: La Crema 2010 Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)

Description: Disagreeable for its harsh acidity and vegetal streak that mars the cherries and suggests a bitter green herb. Disappointing.
Title: La Crema 2008 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Earthy, raspberry-like aromas, nondescript ripe fruit and herb flavors, and a rounded texture make this a serviceable house wine.
Title: Cartlidge & Browne 2013 Pinot Noir (North Coast)

Description: Soft and vegetal, it has steamed asparagus, mushroom and cherry cola flavors.
Title: Soquel Vineyards 2010 Lester Family Vineyard Partners' Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Description: Some raspberry fruit in the aroma, but things turn rapidly earthy and herbal, suggesting dried tomato, rhubarb and oregano. The flavors are simple and uninspiring. Soft, mild, rustic and thin are other words that come to mind.
Title: Camelot 1997 Pinot Noir (California)

Description: Sturdy and basic, this Pinot Noir has vegetal aromas, modest fruit flavors, and a dry, lean texture. Aromas suggest tomato and herbs, while flavors are more rich.
Title: Camelot NV Pinot Noir (California)

Description: Tastes a little vegetal and simple, with cherry jam, asparagus and sweet oak flavors. Not a success, and a particular disappointment compared to the winery's other 2010 single-vineyard Pinots.
Title: Gary Farrell 2010 Ramal Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Description: The cold vintage took its price, making the wine lean and minty.
Title: Rancho Sisquoc 2011 Flood Family Vineyards Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

Description: This is heavy and overripe, with prune jelly flavors.
Title: La Crema 2010 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Description: This Pinot is dry, silky and simple, with cherry pie flavors. There's a vegetal, green streak that's disagreeable.
Title: Carmel Road 2012 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

Description: It’s got a good color, a pretty ruby, and the aromas suggest sun-dried tomatoes, beetroot, and just the faintest hint of cherry, with sweeter, vanilla-accented notes. Very soft, with low acidity and raspberry-cherry fruit flavors.
Title: Monterey Vineyard 1999 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

Description: Smells raisiny, feels hot, tastes overripe.
Title: Hunt Cellars 2009 Imagine Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
